definition: lit. honeyed words, a sword in the belly (idiom); fig. hypocritical and murderous
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
honey
abdomen/stomach/belly
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
variant of 劍|剑[jian4]

sentences.english: Don't believe him for he is only a suger coated.
sentences.chinese: 不要相信他他只一个口蜜腹剑的人。

sentences.english: That snake in the grass cheated me of my money.
sentences.chinese: 那个口蜜腹剑的家伙骗了我的钱。

sentences.english: Don't believe about him for he is only a sugar coated .
sentences.chinese: 不要相信他，因他只是一个口蜜腹剑的人。

sentences.english: They are indeed "friends" with "honey on their lips and murder in their hearts".
sentences.chinese: 现在这些所谓朋友，正是“口蜜腹剑”的朋友。

definition: two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
lit. a dagger hidden in smiles (idiom); friendly manners belying hypocritical intentions/when the fox preaches, look to the geese
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
treacherous and murderous
outside appearance and inner reality differ (idiom); not what it seems/saying one thing but meaning sth different
hypocrite
words of a Buddha, heart of a snake (idiom); two-faced/malicious and duplicitous
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
scheming/calculating
snob
malicious/treacherous/wicked and crafty
(fig.) adaptable/able to deal with various kinds of people and situations/(derog.) insincere/two-faced
pinyin: jian4 ren2 shuo1 ren2 hua4 , jian4 gui3 shuo1 gui3 hua4
related.word: 见人说人话，见鬼说鬼话

definition: to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
hypocrisy/pretended righteousness
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
